name: Pr. NOURY Soraya
role: Department of Veterinary Biological and Pharmaceutical Sciences, Physiology and Therapeutics Unit, IAV Hassan II, Rabat
bio:
Pr. Soraya NOURY is a researcher-teacher and head of the Physiology and Therapeutics Unit at the Hassan II Institute of Agronomy and Veterinary Medicine (Rabat, Morocco). A specialist in physiological and therapeutic approaches applied to animal health, she is actively involved in developing the One Health concept, integrating animal, human, and environmental dimensions.

Her work focuses on the pathophysiology of animal diseases with zoonotic potential, alternative therapies (phytotherapy and aromatherapy), and animal welfare. These three areas are essential for risk prevention and the sustainability of health systems. Engaged in several national and international projects, she works to spread the One Health culture among students, professionals, and the general public. She is also the 2nd Vice-President of the AMARINNOVA association, dedicated to research and innovation, which is currently organizing CIRIV'26.

name: Pr. LAAKILI Amal
bio:
Pr. Laakili Amal is a researcher-teacher at the Higher Institute of Nursing Professions and Health Techniques (ISPITS Rabat, Morocco). A specialist in biotechnology and molecular biology, her work focuses on the genetic diversity of endemic plant species in Morocco.

Committed to developing the One Health concept, she teaches molecular biology, varietal selection, and cell biology. She is a member of the Moroccan Association for Biosecurity, Biosafety, and Health Safety (AMBS), member of the Training, Research, and Standards division.

name: Pr. Aicha MADKOUR
role: Professor Biologist, Specialist in Human and Animal Reproduction, FSR-UM5, President of Have Fenn Association
bio:
Pr Aicha Madkour is a professor in human reproduction and fertility at the Faculty of Sciences of Rabat-UM5. Her work focuses on major infertility pathologies (PCOS, endometriosis, PMS, recurrent miscarriages, unexplained infertility, varicocele).

She directs the CERAM-FSR animal facility, dedicated to experimental animal models, in a One Health approach linking human and animal health.

President of the Have Fenn association for art and science and the TCLI-FSR club, pioneers of scientific theater, she works for public awareness through art. She collaborates with fertility centers, veterinarians, toxicologists, and co-directs the IoT Fertility project with EMI.
